**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-07T02:42:37Z" title="10/07/2016 02:42  AM" data-short="7 yr">October 7, 2016</time> by DerekL1963**

>

> On 10/2/2016 at 3:19 AM, sdj64 said:
> 
> 
> I am thinking about changing the way the mod list works for 1.2 though, it's gotten very clunky and has been the most time consuming part of the challenge to manage.  So there may be changes.
> 

There's something that I've been wondering about the way science returns are handled, and since you mention rethinking how modded entries work, I think this is a good time to bring it up.

Perhaps it may be a good idea to have two categories for highest science returns: one category for stock science equipment, and another category for science-focused attempts with permitted science equipment mods installed. It's a very different challenge to design a lander that contains all of the stock equipment than it is to design one that contains all of the stock equipment plus all that DMagic provides (I'm not referencing other mods here because I'm not sure if there are any other allowed ones that add in science equipment). DMagic also has some very large pieces of equipment for orbital science that (and I can speak from experience here) are very much a pain to attach to a vehicle other than a dedicated science satellite. The option for modded science gathering attempts might also make rovers more worthwhile, since there's so much added benefit to a half-hour drive to the next biome.

[@sdj64](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/100819-sdj64/)  Could you double check my [modlist](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/148872-onward-to-jool-a-jool-5-challenge-log/&do=findComment&comment=2798199)?  AFAICT, it should be good to go.

1.2 has arrived!  And with it, some new and improved rules, designed to make your Jool 5 experience easy and hassle-free.  As always, there is nothing banned in the new rules that was previously allowed, so your in-progress designs do not need to be changed.

I know that there will be some backlash especially with the mod list decision.  The change will hopefully bring more variety and encourage more players to attempt this challenge if they don't have to leave behind their favorite mods.  There were relatively few attempts in 1.1, so hopefully this change will bring more people to take on the Jool 5.

I hope that the change does not cheapen the accomplishment for those who accomplished it already.  Like the majority of challenges that allow mods, there will be a note STOCK or MODDED in the descriptions for all of the upcoming 1.2 entries.

[@DerekL1963](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57091-derekl1963/) all of the mods on your list are allowed (both in 1.1.3 before the rule change and in 1.2 after).

> 
>

> [@DerekL1963](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57091-derekl1963/) all of the mods on your list are allowed (both in 1.1.3 before the rule change and in 1.2 after).
> 

Thanks!  I've done all my practice runs and setup in 1.1.3...  and as much as I'd love to be one of the first to climb on the 1.2 board, I'm going to dance with the one I'm with as it were.  

I like the new rules setup, better to just have once category ("banned").  Makes your life much easier.

My crazy <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Space Carrier has made it to Minmus!  At about 140 <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> short, but Jeb's still grinning despite the bridge being the only part still in one piece.

![Kk3dSBo.png](http://i.imgur.com/Kk3dSBo.png)

With careful piloting, I should be able to pull this off!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-13T23:54:21Z" title="10/13/2016 11:54  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 13, 2016</time> by sdj64**

My latest project:  SSTJ5

![ossVB02.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ossVB02.jpg)

Fully reusable, (no <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>)

And were done:  [http://imgur.com/a/mK5Ij](http://imgur.com/a/mK5Ij)

Mother ship and all landers are single stage.

Guess this is the first entry in 1.2?    Is this the first fulle reusable entry wo <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>?

5 Kerbals where on the mission, 1-2 landed on each moon.

Mods: <abbr title="Kerbal Engineer Redux (mod)">KER</abbr>, mechJeb, PreciseNode

<abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> info: Hard to say with airbreathing engines, but the mothership had over 4 km/s <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>.  Tylo/Vall lander had little over 5km/s and the ion lander had over 9km/s.

Flawless as always, [@Nefrums](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145422-nefrums/).  Congratulations, you are the first finisher of the Jool 5 Challenge in 1.2, on level 3!  ~~I am not sure but I do think it's the first non-<abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> fully reusable entry.~~ There has been one before, EvermoreAlpaca's modular grand tour in 1.0.5.  Great job with the compact landers and fitting everything into one Mk3 cargo bay, and an impressively small plane overall.

Oh, I didn't catch that.  It does have 5 sections...

Also, I have successfully landed my carrier on Minmus!  Now the real mission can begin!  The goal for the mission is to go to every biome in the Jool system for maximum science points (I will see if the ship can make it back from low Jool atmosphere.  Probably it can't since it will overheat and also not have enough fuel to return).  As a bonus, it has a crew capacity of 35, and 25 Kerbals are on board.  Its <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> ability with all chemical rockets means that the whole carrier can land on every moon.  As you can see, it uses <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>, it also carries a plane, rover, and lander that can be refueled from the ship.

I will probably start a thread in mission reports soon, to avoid repeatedly posting here.

![tcYCZTl.png](http://i.imgur.com/tcYCZTl.png)

I can't even build a cargo <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> much less a Jool 5 variant. Excellent work, as ever.

Also you are right, EvermoreAlpaca did do it before back in March.  And with an entire grand tour!

Go to Pol first!  Vall is much higher on delta V since you have to spend about 1000 getting from orbit to the surface.  Despite being farther, Pol is much lower gravity and you can use a Tylo gravity assist to get there.  My ship probably wouldn't be able to go direct from Laythe to Vall either.  From any moon, Pol is the easiest refueling stop especially with gravity assists to help you out.

0.o I'd never even considered that. I'll be sure to try - with my NEWER, AWESOMERDER AND SHINIER spaceplane ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

A quick update on my submission-in-progress: I have initiated a flyby of Laythe putting me into orbit where I will flyby laythe 2 successive times and then by Tylo. I am considering dropping landers off early but I will need the ion shuttle for Laythe, I might b able to balance it though. If not the mothership can easily get the job done.

I should update too...  My mothership is at Jool, and the first landing (Tylo) is in progress.   Only RL has kept me busy, a long awaited book on naval command and control finally arrived, and somehow I'm way behind on my anime...
